text: Yagya Bahadur Thapa () is a recognised martyr of Nepal. He was given martyrdom status by Government of Nepal on March 2016. He was born in 1917 and from Okhaldhunga district and a member of Nepali Congress in the 1970s when it was banned.Shrestha, Nanda R. Historical dictionary of Nepal. Rowman & Littlefield, 2016. p364 Along with Bhim Narayan Shrestha, he was a leader in armed revolt in 1974 and was a leader in the banned Nepali Congress. He was implicated in an bomb attack on the King of Nepal in Biratnagar.Parmanand, The Nepali Congress in Exile, University Book House (Nepal) 1978, p68 He joined with mutineers at the eastern hill district of Okhaldunga in an attempted armed revolution. He was arrested attempting to capture Okhaldunga. A one man tribunal of Ridhima Nand Rajacharya gave death penalty to Captain Yagya Bahadur Thapa and Bhim Narayan Shrestha. Supreme Court of Nepal held decision of death penalty given by one man tribunal to Retired Captain Yagya Bahadur Thapa and Bhim Narayan Shrestha. In 1978 he was shot and killed in a forest south of Hetauda. ==References== Category:Nepali Congress politicians Category:Bagale Thapa Category:1917 births Category:1978 deaths Category:Deaths by firearm in Nepal Category:People from Okhaldhunga District
